greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The partial digital sums of n from left to right mod 10 give the digits of a(n).
comment: Analogous to A006068 for the decimal base.
For any n, the sequence n, a(n), a(a(n)), a(a(a(n))),... is periodic.
The periods encountered between 0 and 10^6 are:
link: Paul Tek, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Paul Tek, Parity of the decimal digits of n, a(n), a(a(n)), a(a(a(n))),... with n=200!
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(v=digits(n)); for(i=2,#v, v[i]=(v[i]+v[i-1])%10); fromdigits(v); \\ _Kevin Ryde_, May 15 2020
results.author: _Paul Tek_, May 27 2013
